alert.note: Alert for Butler; Cowley (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 10:57AM CDT until May 08 at 8:14PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Kansas... Walnut River at Winfield affecting Butler and Cowley Counties. For the Walnut River...including El Dorado, Augusta, Winfield, Arkansas City...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Walnut River at Winfield. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, A large portion of the fairgrounds flood along with rural roads about 3 miles northwest of Winfield that are near the river. Then one mile west of the city of Rock, expect 30th Road to be closed due to high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.3 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Walnut River Winfield 18.0 22.0 Fri 10 am CD 20.7 15.3 7.4 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
